nodes.bodyText: Agreed, this looks like an error in the PR.

Good catch. The effect of -1 * -1 = 1.
Fixed
It was not used. It was set, but never used. I think it leftovers from when @toregge rewrote how we do TLS replay.
It was not used. It was set, but never used.

+
+MetricLockGuard::MetricLockGuard(std::mutex & mutex)
+    : _guard(mutex)
+{}
+
+bool
+MetricLockGuard::owns(const std::mutex & mutex) const {
+    return (_guard.mutex() == &mutex) && !_guard.owns_lock();

nodes.bodyText: Yes, 2 bugs cancelling each other causing the tests to still pass.

nodes.bodyText:
Some compilers warn about private member variables that appears to be unused. The variable is never read by the C++
code, so the only use might be indirectly (e.g. when inspecting core dumps).
I think that having variables around for future possible coredumps is not a good pattern.
